titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia, Lewis E 140: Rule of the order of the Jesuati of San Giusto alle mura, Florence

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This manuscript is a humanistic copy of the rule of the Gesuati and additional constitutions approved at a general assembly in Florence in 1485. It belonged to the Gesuati monastery of San Giusto outside the walls of Florence. Its colophon records that it was copied by Piero di Simon Bartholi in Florence in 1510. It has a title page and two additional pages with illuminated borders and a decorated initial at the beginning of each chapter.

msItem.title: Rule of the order of the Jesuati of San Giusto alle mura, Florence

respStmt.persName: Poveri Ingesuati of San Giusto, Florence

msItem.colophon: Finito discrivere Nel nome di yhu La pre[se]nte opera A di 19 di novembre 1510. p[er] me Piero di simon bartholi Cittadino fiore[n]tino in Firenze (fol. 62r).

msItem.title: L'ordine e forma de costumi et vita et usanze

supportDesc.extent: i+62+i; 210 x 140 mm bound to 223 x 150 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto

p.catchwords: Horizontal catchwords by the scribe with decorative marks, quires 1-4, bottom right last verso (fols. 10v, 20v, 30v, 40v)

layoutDesc.layout: Written in one column of twenty-two lines; ruled in lead with vertical bounding lines; written area: 145 x 90 mm

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Scribe: Piero di Simon Bartholi, of Florence

decoDesc.decoNote: Trilateral border in gold and colors, of formalized floral design with medallions at the top and bottom containing the sacred monogram within gold lines (fol. 1r); floral borders along the inner margins of two other pages (fols. 53r, 60r); an historiated L on the first page showing a brother of the Jesuati (fol. 1r); decorative initials in gold on red, blue, and green grounds at the beginning of chapters, capitals heightened in yellow; rubrication in red

binding.p: Contemporary brown morocco over wooden boards, paneled sides with two blind tooled arabesque borders, in the center the sacred monogram YHS gilt; impressions of former clasps and bosses; paper label on spine with title in ink, Costumi e vita de' Poveri [?] Gesuati

history.provenance: Originally owned by the Ingesuati at the monastery of San Giusto, outside the walls of Florence at the Porta Pinti (fol. 50r); Thomas F. Richardson, Boston (stamp, front flyleaf recto); obtained by John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia, 1919 (signature and date in ink, front flyleaf recto); given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936
